== Who I am ==

My name is Manuel Diewald and I joined the Ubuntu Kernel Team in early 2023. I received a master's degree in Computer Science from the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. Before joining Canonical, I was working on software for embedded systems. I have always been an advocate for free software and enjoy working on personal open source projects in my free time.

== My Ubuntu story ==

My first contact with Linux was around 2005 during an introductory course to programming in high school - Fedora Linux. My personal journey in the Linux world started when I switched my workstation to Debian 'Lenny' in 2009. After a long stint of being a passionate Gentoo user, my journey lead me to Arch Linux and eventually, Ubuntu. Even though I have been using Ubuntu as my main operating system for a comparably short amount of time, it has always been the distribution I would suggest to anyone that expressed interest in switching to a free software based system. Its works-out-of-the-box character makes it a great choice for beginners and power users alike. I am very happy to be able to contribute to Ubuntu full time now.

=== My involvement ===

I am mostly involved with the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/StableReleaseUpdates|Stable Release Updates]]</nowiki> cycle, maintaining a set of kernel packages. I mainly contribute to the Raspberry Pi Ubuntu kernels. In addition to delivering SRU updates for kernel packages, I investigate user reported bugs or fix issues identified by regression tests of our kernels. Whenever I can, I try to expand our documentation along the way. Recently, I also started to get involved with upstream stable updates for the main kernel.

=== Plans for the future ===

Short term, I aim to receive upload rights in order to be able to work more autonomously and to not cause additional work for sponsors. In the future I want to contribute more to tooling and automation for the team and would be very interested in being involved more with upstream work.

=== Things I could do better ===

I struggle most with balancing different tasks that have priority at the same time. I want to be better at distributing focus time between tasks and thus to be able to finish them in an efficient, timely manner. Furthermore, proactively engaging in activities outside of my usual workload when time allows could broaden my knowledge in many areas.

=== Thadeu Cascardo ===
==== General feedback ====

Manuel has demonstrated good grasp of the kernel cranking process and produced
many kernel packages which were good for uploads to the archive. Those were of
good quality and care has been taken to prepare packages with the right
contents, like security updates only when the generic packages have already
been prepared for a later release with other contents.

I have uploaded some of the packages Manuel Diewlad has prepared and I trust
him to upload kernel packages directly to the archive.

==== Areas of improvement ====

Manuel could exercise uploading other kernel flavours, specially ones with
signed and lrm packages.
